SEARCH

Class DungeonGenerator

java.lang.Object
DungeonGenerator
public class DungeonGenerator extends Object
The DungeonGenerator class is responsible for generating a dungeon represented as a 2D array. It provides methods to generate the dungeon, reset the dungeon matrix, and start the dungeon generation process.

The class includes several static fields for color codes used in console output, as well as fields for the dungeon matrix and coordinates.

Example usage: 

     DungeonGenerator generator = new DungeonGenerator();
     int[][] dungeon = generator.generateDungeon(10);

Note: If the testing mode is enabled, certain actions will print messages to the console.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Caden Finley

  • Method Details

    • generateDungeon

      public int[][] generateDungeon(int size)
      Generates a dungeon of the specified size.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the dungeon to generate
      Returns:
      a 2D array representing the generated dungeon

    • isPathConnected

      public boolean isPathConnected(int x1, int y1, int x2, int y2)
      Checks if there is a path connecting two points in a matrix. This method uses Breadth-First Search (BFS) to determine if there is a path from the starting point (x1, y1) to the ending point (x2, y2) in the given matrix. The matrix represents a grid where a value greater than 0 indicates a walkable cell, and a value of 0 indicates an obstacle.
      Parameters:
      x1 - The x-coordinate of the starting point.
      y1 - The y-coordinate of the starting point.
      x2 - The x-coordinate of the ending point.
      y2 - The y-coordinate of the ending point.
      matrix - The matrix representing the grid.
      Returns:
      true if there is a path connecting (x1, y1) to (x2, y2), false otherwise.

    • testArrays

      public boolean testArrays()
      Tests the connectivity and adjacency of specific values within a 2D array (matrix). This method checks if the values 9, 8, 3, 2, 4, and 6 are present in the given matrix. If any of these values are not found, the method returns false. If all values are found, it checks the following conditions: - The value 9 is connected to the values 8, 3, 2, and 4. - The value 8 is not adjacent to the values 6, 4, and 3. - The number of rooms (cells) with the value 2 is at least 2.
      Returns:
      true if all conditions are met, false otherwise

    • findValue

      public static int[] findValue(int[][] matrix, int value)
      Finds the coordinates of a specified value in a 2D matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the 2D array to search through
      value - the value to find in the matrix
      Returns:
      an array containing the row and column indices of the value, or null if the value is not found

    • getDirections

      public static int[] getDirections(int[][] matrix, int x, int y)
      Returns the values of the cells in the four cardinal directions (up, down, left, right) from the given coordinates (x, y) in the matrix. If a direction is out of bounds, it adds 0.
      Parameters:
      matrix - The 2D array representing the dungeon.
      x - The x-coordinate of the current cell.
      y - The y-coordinate of the current cell.
      Returns:
      An array of integers representing the values of the neighboring cells.

    • createRoomsBeenTo

      public static int[][] createRoomsBeenTo(int size)
      Creates a 2D array representing rooms that have been visited.
      Parameters:
      size - the size of the 2D array to be created
      Returns:
      a 2D array of integers with the specified size

    • numberOfRooms

      public static int numberOfRooms(int[][] matrix, int find)
      Counts the number of rooms in the matrix that match the specified value.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the 2D array representing the dungeon
      find - the value to search for in the matrix
      Returns:
      the number of rooms that match the specified value

    • numberOfAllRooms

      public static int numberOfAllRooms(int[][] matrix)
      Counts the number of non-zero rooms in the given matrix.
      Parameters:
      matrix - the 2D array representing the dungeon
      Returns:
      the number of rooms that are not zero

    • printMap

      public static void printMap(int[][] passedMatrix)
      Prints the dungeon map represented by the given 2D array. Non-zero values are printed within square brackets, while zero values are printed as spaces.
      Parameters:
      passedMatrix - the 2D array representing the dungeon map

    • printAdjacentRoomsAndCurrentRoomAndUnlockedRooms

      public static void printAdjacentRoomsAndCurrentRoomAndUnlockedRooms(int[][] passedMatrix, int[][] unlocked, int[] passedPosition, boolean revealed)
      Prints the current room, adjacent rooms, and unlocked rooms in the dungeon.
      Parameters:
      passedMatrix - 2D array representing the dungeon layout.
      unlocked - 2D array representing the unlocked status of rooms.
      passedPosition - Array representing the current position of the player.
      revealed - Boolean indicating whether the map is fully revealed or not.

    • drawRoom

      public static void drawRoom(int[][] localDungeon, int[][] visitedRoom, int x, int y, int numberofEnemies, boolean revealed)
      Draws a room in the dungeon based on the given parameters.
      Parameters:
      localDungeon - The dungeon layout represented as a 2D matrix.
      visitedRoom - The array indicating which rooms have been visited.
      x - The x-coordinate of the room to draw.
      y - The y-coordinate of the room to draw.
      numberofEnemies - The number of enemies to place in the room.
      revealed - Whether the dungeon is revealed or not.
